data.title: Dinner
data.text: We came here for dinner with our friends before a show at the  Gem theatre. We arrived alittle early and sat at the bar. We talked with the owner Doug. Great guy and made great drinks. We were seated at our table when our friends came our waiter was great and told us all about the specials and what was good on the menu. We all ordered different fishes and we all enjoyed our meals. I will definitely be coming back!!

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Good food.  Menu has something for everyone.  I had the tri-trip, which was very tasty.  My husband had the salmon (he said it was very good) and the boys had hamburgers  The waiter was very nice and the prices seem fair.

data.title: Pleasant Experience
data.text: I visited this establishment based on a recommendation from locals and tripadvisor reviews. I ordered the top sirloin prepared medium.  The plate came with veggies and scalloped potatoes. The potatoes were very good. The veggies were okay and the sirloin was prepared medium well instead of medium. My friend had a pasta and she said it was very good.  The staff is very friendly. I might give the place another try but nothing to write home about.

data.title: Nice little place
data.text: I would say I am  regular here. Once a week my girlfriend and I come here. They never go wrong here. The place makes you feel like family. Kevin is our favorite guy that makes sure we get good service. Lately they have been really busy but you can tell they are really trying to provide good service. The food is really good. I usually get a sandwich. The cocktails are also good. The music and atmosphere is a nice little lounge. I recommend coming to anyone who wants a local place with good American cuisine.

data.title: Poor Service Ruined a Good Meal
data.text:
We were going to the Gem theatre to see a play and choose Doug's Downtown Grill because it was right next to the theatre.  Arriving at 6:30 the restaurant only had a few booths occupied so we thought we had plenty of time for the 8:00 play.  Wrong!
We told the hostess we wanted quick service and she said she would get our server.  10 minutes later at 6:40 still no server but we noticed a server at a table across from us waiting on a table of two women who had come in after us.  We asked that server to wait on us first but he declined  and after a couple of more minutes our server arrived.  We quickly ordered in under a minute and told her we were anxious to be served because we were going to the play.  She assured us it would be no problem.  We ordered no wine or even ice, just water, as we thought that might slow up the serving process.  It took until 7:00 for the soup (a delicious turkey pot pie) and the rather ordinary side salad to arrive with mostly iceberg lettuce.  No tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. and only a couple of romaine leaves.  By 7:10 we had finished the soup and salad and anxiously waited for our entree.  And waited, and waited, and waited, and waited.  Others had arrived and we noticed they were being served bread with their soup and salads but we were not offered any.  Tick tick 7:15,  tick tick 7:20, tick tick 7:25, tick tick 7:30, tick tick 7:35.  We asked about our meal as we had now been in the restaurant over an hour and our server apologized but said they were busy because of the play.  They were now busy but they were not busy when we arrived over an hour earlier.  Our meals of ribs and try tip arrived we had 12 minutes to wolf it down before we had to leave to pick up our tickets at will-call at the Gem theatre.  I complained about no bread and they finally brought us some.  I had a couple of bites of the trip-tip which was surprisingly good and tried to eat the vegetables getting a few down before I had to leave to get our tickets.  We were given boxes and we boxed up the meat and potatoes (scalloped rather than twice-baked listed on the menu that we wanted.  We left the vegetables.  On our bill they had included $2.00 extra for mushrooms on our trip tip that we ordered but did not receive.  I rushed out to get our tickets and my wife went to the restroom to wash up.  We met up at the lobby of the theatre, stressed out from the experience and exhausted.  The play Bye Bye Birdie was terrific.  At intermission we ran into the party of 4 that had been across from us in the restaurant and they ended up having all of their food boxed and Doug's felt so bad they comped the meal for them.  Ours was not comped and we were the ones served a late meal, no bread until it did not matter, and no refills on our water.  My wife thought some of the wait staff and especially the hostess were dressed slovenly.  1 1/2 hours is not enough time for this slow serving restaurant so if you are going to give it a try before a play I would say you need 2  1/2 hours to be safe.

data.title: Yummy food; happy service!
data.text: This is a really nice local restaurant with yummy food.  We had the daily fish special (Halibut with macadamia orange sauce).  The flavors were so wonderful, and the size of the serving was huge!  The service was so friendly and happy.  I like that.  A couple of minor mishaps (forgot our appetizer but didn't charge us), but we were made to feel so good...didn't worry about it.

data.title: Amazing Restaurant A Fe Minutes Away From Disneyland
data.text:
As we were travelling from Australia, a good friend and local Anaheim local wanted to take us to a quality 'non touristy" restaurant in the area. We we immediately impressed with Doug's Downtown Grill and we were made welcome, as soon as we entered the restaurant. 

The service was superb and our waiter was very attentive with our drinks and refills. On our friends recommendation, my son and I ordered the THE ‘MCDOUG’ which is a baby back rib sandwich. we remove the bones & grill slathered in bbq sauce, and serve with grilled onions & dill pickle chips on a toasted french roll. One word DELICIOUS 

My wife ordered the Asian Chicken Salad which was mesquite grilled chicken on a bed of spring mix with fresh mango, oranges, roasted cashews, & fried rice noodles. served with sesame asian dressing. She also enjoyed her meal very much.

Doug's Downtown Grill provides quality food at a reasonable price. If you are in the Disneyland area and want to avoid overpriced tourist trap food, head to Doug's!!!

.

data.title: Will most defiantly will return. Great Local Establishment!
data.text: We were greeted when we arrived by the owner, Doug and were promptly seated. Our server, Donna, had some very nice suggestions for us, which we took her up on. Her service was great, never an empty water glass or Wine Glass, she also suggested a wine to accompany our meal, and afterward was offered a dessert and after meal beverage. Our table was kept clear of used dishes and silverware. This is Great Service and really enjoyed it. Most defiantly will return very soon. Also a thoughtful "Thank You" by Doug and Donna while departing. Such a nice place.

data.title: Great food for lunch or dinner
data.text: We had a party of six including three pre-teens and we stopped for a late lunch/early dinner.  There was only one table being served at the time but when we left an hr and a half later it was busy on a Saturday night.  The menu had a lot to choose from and the food was very good. I believe we had the manager serve us and he was very personable and accommodating to our family's needs.  A little delay and trouble with staff running my credit card, I didn't like that my card was passed off to someone else. Overall very good, we will be back!

data.title: Pleasant surprise on a Saturday afternoon.
data.text: We were out shopping for plumbing supplies and decided to stop for lunch. Wanting to support the businesses along Main st., we decided to give them a try. Quiet, not very full, very clean looking and friendly were my first impressions. I ordered a half Asian chicken salad and my husband got a burger...made to order. The warm bread and softened butter really whet my appetite. My salad was more than enough for a full salad ,loaded with grilled chicken, mango chunks and cashews. Wonderful. The restaurant did not have any background music playing which is ideal if you are trying to converse with your dinner partners. Wish they had more customers...hope they are fuller in the evenings. We were very pleased with the meal...slightly higher in price for an everyday lunch ($8 for the salad ,$12 for the burger) but the flavors were superb.

data.title: Homemade deliciousness!
data.text: On our first night of a ten day trip to the LA area we stumbled upon this gem. It's located on a great cobblestone street in Garden Grove. We were warmly greeted by the owner Doug. Our server was the most friendly and funny woman and answered all of our questions about the menu. The home cooked food was delicious, the atmosphere was great. And to top it off the pie was incredible! We just might have to go back again before we leave!

data.title: Worst experience ever!!!!!
data.text: Set up reservations for us and 27 friends for dinner prior to heading to GEM theater.  Owner knew our plans asked us to limit our choices to 5 which we did. Arrived at 5:30pm - and the last couple got served their food at 7:50pm which they immediately had boxed up to go since the play started at 8pm.  Food came out 1 at time and was either cold or not right - some got this some got that.  No apologies, no explanations no service no comps no making us happy.  At 7:30 p.m. I walked out but my foolish husband paid for my meal and had it boxed up. We kept asking the wait staff and telling them we had theater tickets and all we got was "food is coming" Horrible Night!

data.title: DDG as an Italian Restaurant
data.text:
I've always wondered about restaurant reviewers that knock a restaurant when they order a dish that clearly isn't something that is a specialty of the house (the steak at IHOP may be excellent, but I will probably never find out). But that is exactly what my wife and I did - ordered pasta at a grill.

But first things first. We went on a Saturday evening, and the place was only half full. People - it's only about 3 miles from the madhouse of Disney - go give it a try. Staff was friendly, and yes, Doug the owner, stopped by to make sure everything was fine. Servings sizes are large, so be aware. Ambiance is muted and good for conversations. It is in a college area, but it is definitely not a college student hang out.

Now the food. We did order the egg rolls - not on the menu - and they were very good. These are more southwest egg rolls, not Chinese. Stuffed with a gooey  cheese and a small amount of a slightly spicy meat mixture - maybe Chorizo. A nice sweet dipping sauce to slightly cool them.

Our pasta dishes came with either a soup or salad, and we both opted for the salads. Salads, like other dishes here, are big. My wife got the Balsamic vinaigrette dressing and said it was very full flavored. I got the house dressing which is homemade blue cheese. I found it to be extremely mild - almost no blue cheese flavor. Not bad, just not really blue cheese.

There are only 3 pasta dishes on the menu. My wife got the penne pasta with shrimp and loved it. I got the pasta special, which was shrimp, artichoke hearts, and fontina cheese over egg noodles. Both dishes came with two large pieces of garlic toast. I really enjoyed mi dish as well, and both made really good left overs for lunch the next day.

My suggestion is to give it a try. A little pricey for Garden Grove but not for Disney, but you will get a couple of meals out of them.

data.title: Doug's Downtown Grill - A Hidden Gem
data.text: Meeting up with some friends from LA, we took a chance on Doug's Downtown Grill based on what I'd read here on Trip Adviser. Very friendly place with good service and a menu full of great choices. As we were there for dinner, we chose entrees: Tri Tip and Salmon...both came with soup or salad, julienned veggies and another side.  All of it was delicious and well prepared to order. We were celebrating our friends' wedding anniversary which our charming waitress, Luta, noted. We ordered the nectarine crumble for dessert and the happy couple got the yummy peach shortcake on the house. The dining area is conducive to conversation, unlike so many eateries these days where the music and room acoustics are so loud you can't hear yourself think let alone speak. We were there over 3 hours, nobody rushed us and we felt well taken care of.  I feel we've found a hidden gem which we'll recommend and return to soon.

data.title: Doug's has great food, service and "many" awesome homemade desserts!
data.text: We checked a few reviews and found Doug's Downtown Grill in Garden Grove.  The service was great, and the owner went out of his way to make sure we were happy with everything.  We were very glad to have found such a friendly and nice place to have dinner with long time friends. We will all be coming back soon!  Save room for the many dessert choices.  We shared the peach, strawberry shortcake and brownie they were awesome!

data.title: Great food, great price
data.text: I dined at Doug's Downtown Grill twice during my stay in Garden Grove on business.  The customer service is excellent, food just as good, and the price is affordable.  I will definitely be visiting Doug's on my next trip to So Cal.

data.title: Good quality establishment
data.text:
We have just got back from DDG after a pleasant dining experience. My observations are as follows:

Very friendly service from the start. 

Good choice on the menu, including children's menu. 

Superb salads, the best I've tried so far. 

Good steaks, even though ours were overcooked (medium/ well instead of medium. My wife's was well done instead of medium). Bear this in mind when ordering. 

Desserts are oversized. This is a bit of a turn-off when you're already full. 

Temperature of the establishment was too low. We were pleased when we got out, and we were wearing cardigans! 

Aside from all that, it was a very good meal with a nice personal friendly service!

data.title: Great Local Restaurant
data.text:
Food and service at Doug's is always great.  It is wonderful to go to a restaurant where everyone knows your name, greets you with a smile and does all they can to make your dining experience a great one.  We have been going to Doug's ever since it opened and are never disappointed.

Ann, Visiting from Seattle, WA.  Betty, Garden Grove

data.title: Scrumptious food!
data.text: I was out of town on a business trip.We were looking for a reasonable place to eat,without having the Disney rush on a Friday night. We stumbled upon Doug's Downtown Grill! What a treat it was! Located in historic Grarden Grove, it was nothing fancy, but looked nice from the outside. The reviews on trip advisor helped us make the decision to give it a try! Boy were we happy we did! The service was exceptional,the owner was there overseeing everything,with a great big smile! Let's get to the food.....first we ordered the egg rolls, (can't find them on the menu) but our waitress suggested them. Dont  know exactly what they had inside, they were more like a cross between an egg roll and a burrito, very scrumptious! Our friend ordered the Ahi tuna salad, fantastic! My girlfriend and I split the prime rib dinner (16oz) it was out of this world! Vegetables were done just right, salad was big enough for us to split, but had no idea it would be so big so we ordered an extra dinner salad. We also had the twice baked potatoes and they were delightful! You can tell everything is homemade! We were too full to try the buttermilk pie, but waitress told us it was his grandmothers homemade recipe! If you are close to Anaheim, and want to have a unforgettable meal, try Doug's Downtown Grill you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Meh
data.text: Meh.   Nothing very special.   The ribs were dry and seemed prepared.   Pretty average.   Service was very good though.
